Here are our bus routes! Some minor edits might occur- please check back on Tuesday for final routes: http://bit.ly/sau39-busroutes

As always, remember that in the first few days, buses can run a few minutes early or late. Please be at your designated bus stop about 10 minutes early.

Also, you cannot ride the bus if you did not choose bus as your primary pick-up or drop-off plan for segment 1!

Parent/Guardian PowerSchool Instructions and the Election Form for Segment 1 are in the process of being sent out as we speak! They are being sent by the system in alphabetical order and is about 1/3 of the way through (as of 11:42 am). Please check your email and your spam/junk folder. The email will be coming from powerschool@sau39.org

If you have any issues, please go to: https://bit.ly/sau39-registration-help

Enjoy! And, THANK YOU for your patience.

post_text:
Hey everyone- wanted to give you an update on our PowerSchool system and the parent/guardian election form we have referenced this week. We are working on it! We have to get it just right before we send it out. Its getting there!

In lieu of sending it out, I made a brief video that will at least show you what it will look like when you get it.

DO NOT FOLLOW THE STEPS LISTED IN THIS VIDEO YET! The system is not online yet and it will not work for you, but again, I'm hoping seeing a preview will be helpful!

-Adam

post_text:
Parents of C-W students- after hearing your feedback last night and this morning, we are working on an alternative plan that may allow for an earlier drop-off of students. We're going to continue working on it throughout the day today and expect there to be an update at the parent meeting this afternoon. Expect a compromise that we think will alleviate most (if not all) of the concerns raised so far. Thank you for your feedback as we work to get this re-opening plan right!

-Adam
text:
Parents of C-W students- after hearing your feedback last night and this morning, we are working on an alternative plan that may allow for an earlier drop-off of students. We're going to continue working on it throughout the day today and expect there to be an update at the parent meeting this afternoon. Expect a compromise that we think will alleviate most (if not all) of the concerns raised so far. Thank you for your feedback as we work to get this re-opening plan right!

-Adam

post_text:
In planning ways to address the physical infrastructure needs of our schools, the SAU 39 Joint Facilities Advisory Committee is interested in hearing from you!

Lavallee Brensinger Architects has been engaged by the Amherst School District to create a Long-Range Facilities Master Plan for Clark-Wilkins Elementary School and Amherst Middle School.

Several factors contributed to the need for a facilities review and master plan including;
• Aging school buildings in need of significant renovation and/or repair
• Major systems reaching end of life
• Large class sizes in the elementary and middle school placing continued stress on the aging infrastructure and dated systems

Please take a moment to provide us some feedback as we move forward.

https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/RRSDHNJ

Many Thanks,
The SAU 39 Joint Facilities Advisory Committee
shared_text:
SURVEYMONKEY.COM

post_text:
*Fields and Playground Opening Update*

Per the Governor's orders that remove the limit on gatherings, we will be re-opening our fields, playgrounds, parking lots, and grounds on June 15th.

All visitors are required to be familiar with and adhere to all CDC and NH Covid-19 guidelines as well as SAU #39 policies regarding facility use.

We are happy to welcome our community back to our campuses!
text:
*Fields and Playground Opening Update*

Per the Governor's orders that remove the limit on gatherings, we will be re-opening our fields, playgrounds, parking lots, and grounds on June 15th.

All visitors are required to be familiar with and adhere to all CDC and NH Covid-19 guidelines as well as SAU #39 policies regarding facility use.

We are happy to welcome our community back to our campuses!

post_text:
Here is the last “At Home With Adam” episode produced by Shannon Hargreaves and hosted with Amanda Jordan. And here are Amanda’s words to introduce the episode:

Hey everyone! My name is Amanda Jordan and I was a senior at Souhegan this year. For the past 8 weeks I have been working with sophomore Shannon Hargreaves to create a talk show with superintendent Adam Steel. We’ve had so much fun, and it was a nice way to hear about other students’ and teachers’ experiences with remote learning. For our final episode, I interviewed an amazing group of fellow seniors to talk about their experiences at Souhegan. I think it puts into perspective how resilient and selfless my class of 2020 has been these past few months, and I couldn’t be prouder to be a part of it. Thanks to anyone who takes the time to watch :)))

https://youtu.be/csmuWM3h6cY
shared_text:
YOUTUBE.COM
At Home With Adam 7

post_text: Parents: If you would like to order a Saber Strong sign for your Senior or you’d like to show your support for our class of 2020, please go to www.brandingmine.com to purchase signs or banners. Both can be personalized, you will just need to add what you want it to say into the “Notes” section. If you know of any Senior family who wants a sign, but can’t afford it, the Project Graduation Committee has funds available for those students—we do not want anyone to be left out! Please contact Sheelu Joshi-Flegal at sjoshiflegal@sprise.com for more information about that. If you have any questions, please contact Lisa Eastland at eastland@comcast.net

All school fields and facilities are now closed to the public. Unfortunately, our signs restricting access to no more than 10 people at a time, particularly at Souhegan, have not been respected. As a result, I have asked the Amherst Police to begin enforcing a no-trespass order at Souhegan immediately. We will place signs as well.

-Adam
#DebbieDowner

post_text:
After consultation with the Town of Amherst, we have closed our school playgrounds. In addition, we are limiting access to our fields and track at Souhegan to no more than 10 people at a time. While we prefer not to restrict access to facilities and grounds, it is appropriate given the Governor’s emergency orders and is good common sense.

Look for some positive updates later this week. And, has anyone NOT seen Clark-Wilkins teachers busting a move? Check it out!

#hangtough

I’m so impressed with sophomore Shannon Hargreaves who produced this video but also by the girls lacrosse team and all of our students who are making the best of this situation! This experience has learning opportunities baked into every challenge. Our students are learning to persevere, to collaborate in new ways, to communicate despite obstacles, and ultimately that as a country, we overcome!

Other spring sports teams- what have you got????

-Adam

post_text:
Good morning! Eversource shows a significant number of outages in Amherst and Mont Vernon. School will be a “best effort” situation today. Do not worry about connecting with teachers if you do not have power. If you’re out, it’s ok! Most of our teachers also live here so we are all in this together. Even if you have power, your teacher may not!

Here is what you can do today without power:

- Read a book about the great superintendents born in the 80’s;
- Practice an instrument (but the parent handbook says no recorders before 11am or after 11am);
- Draw a picture of you taking your parents out to dinner after you land your first job;
- Shovel the walkway of a nice neighbor (leave the others to save themselves); or
- DO THE DISHES!

In all seriousness, we are all doing the best we can. Family, neighbors, and health all come before school. If you can learn something today, it can be about how to have your priorities straight. #39as1

Adam

PS- if you have power, get to work!

PPS- I am not going to send out a Nixle this morning and wake people up who may already be without power.

post_text:
Here are our wonderful educators getting ready for our new reality of remote learning! Our teachers and staff have had a FANTASTIC attitude about these unknown and unforeseen challenges. It is stressful and stretches all of our skill sets, but these teachers are positive, dedicated, and ready to rock and roll!

Updates:
1. Look for communication today about how material pickup over the next two days;

2. Look for communication by Wednesday about how remote learning will work;

3. Food delivery will start TOMORROW! It is open to all families, not just those with students in the home. Here is how to sign up for food delivery: http://bit.ly/sau39foodsurvey

4. Our next press conference from State/Local/School officials will be Wednesday at 4:00 PM. We had originally said Tuesday, but it will be on Wednesday and will have a limit of 3,000 users. Here is the link for that press conference: https://zoom.us/j/978246672

Have a great day and be safe!

post_text:
We are hosting a press conference today at 4:00 PM for Amherst, Mont Vernon, and SAU #39 regarding COVID-19 and our preparations for school disruption which will happen this week.

Participants in the press conference will be:

Senator Shannon Chandley

Selectmen Peter Lyon (Amherst)
Selectmen Kim Roberge (Mont Vernon)

Town Administrator Dean Shankle (Amherst)

Superintendent Adam Steel (SAU #39)
SAU #39 Board Chair - Amy Facey

To join that press conference, use this link: http://bit.ly/sau39newsconference

All residents of Mont Vernon and Amherst as well as students, staff, and community members of our schools are encouraged to join.

In short, school will be disrupted (aka closed) this week effective immediately through at least April 3, 2020. Our press conference will cover all manner of details about what that disruption will mean for our students, our staff, and our community.

post_text:
Hey folks- I am at Souhegan. There was a small scuffle in the gym today around 11:15 A.M. when the entire student body was gathered. It lasted about 5 seconds and was immediately broken up.

Souhegan administration, teachers, and Amherst PD all worked to resolve the issue quickly and safely.

I have personally reviewed the video of what occurred and all participants have been identified.

Souhegan will be releasing an official statement soon, but wanted to reassure all parents and community members that the situation is under control, Fang Fest is continuing as normal, and we are taking the necessary disciplinary and practical steps to keep all students safe.

-Adam
text:
Hey folks- I am at Souhegan. There was a small scuffle in the gym today around 11:15 A.M. when the entire student body was gathered. It lasted about 5 seconds and was immediately broken up.

Souhegan administration, teachers, and Amherst PD all worked to resolve the issue quickly and safely.

I have personally reviewed the video of what occurred and all participants have been identified.

Souhegan will be releasing an official statement soon, but wanted to reassure all parents and community members that the situation is under control, Fang Fest is continuing as normal, and we are taking the necessary disciplinary and practical steps to keep all students safe.

-Adam

post_text:
For today (Wednesday), be advised there may be some isolated patches of black ice. Normal schedule.

For tomorrow (Thursday), 2-4" of snow expected starting around 1am. Freezing rain and then rain expected during the morning commute. I will be monitoring throughout the day, but anything from a regular day to a delay or a cancellation is possible given the forecast and the anticipated timing.

#EveryDay
#5DayWeeksAreforFlorida

Update at 8:43 pm: No decision tonight. Near certain delay and likely a snow day, but enough can change overnight that I am going to wait. Decision will come no later than 5am.

#YesIWouldRatherCallItNow
#HappyJuly4thStudents

Update 4:27 am: We are closing. DPW's have indicated with the forecast and the type of snow coming down that they will not be able to keep up with the snow in time for a delay to be enough.

post_text:
Update at 4:18am: DPW’s feel confident we will be safe. Drive carefully! Regular day and normal schedule today!

Chance a delay might be needed for tomorrow (Monday). Snow is expected to start around 3-4am and then turn to rain during our normal commute. Should be no more than an inch of snow, but the turnover to rain could create hazardous conditions. I’ll be up early to evaluate.

Also, remember- no school on Tuesday!

#ForAnInch?

post_text: After an icy start to the day, here is the weekly update video. Stay safe tonight, everyone!
text: After an icy start to the day, here is the weekly update video. Stay safe tonight, everyone!

post_text:
Good Morning!

We will have a 2-hour delay today, Friday, February 7, 2020. There is a chance road conditions will not improve in time to have school even after a 2-hour delay. We will update no later than 7 am if we need to close for the day.

Please use caution as there are icy conditions around both towns right now. Thank you to our DPW crews who have been working non-stop to keep up!

Update at 6:35am: we are a go for school today. Road crews feel confident roads will be safe. Leave a little extra time, be careful around bus stops, and have a great day!
text:

Please use caution as there are icy conditions around both towns right now. Thank you to our DPW crews who have been working non-stop to keep up!

Update at 6:35am: we are a go for school today. Road crews feel confident roads will be safe. Leave a little extra time, be careful around bus stops, and have a great day!

post_text:
Tomorrow may be an issue. The forecasted temp just changed to a few degrees lower. The NWS is predicting freezing rain overnight until around 9am.

I have already been in contact with our DPW’s and will be your early evaluating conditions. We will do our best to have school, but icy roads are a deal-breaker.

#ShouldWeHaveSchool
#AnotherNHDebateTonight

post_text:
We are closing schools today based on the timing of the storm and the anticipated freezing rain and sleet during the mid-day/afternoon commute.

This cancellation is #5 for Souhegan and #4 for every other school.

Tomorrow has a chance of being an issue as well. A few degrees either way will be the difference. We will be monitoring today.

The call/text/email will go out at 5am.

Have a great snow day!

Comment below with your favorite snow day movie suggestions!

-Adam

#WannabeMeteorologist
#JuniorMeteorologyMeritBadge

post_text:
Monitoring forecasts for tomorrow (Thursday). Difficult decision regarding school because of the relatively low amount of snow accumulation but the timing during the morning commute and the anticipation of freezing rain and sleet throughout the day. Current forecasts do not indicate a delay would be helpful. I do not expect to make any decisions tonight and that it will be an early morning decision. -Adam
#WakeUpAt0300HRS
#ProllyGetItWrong
